sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都表示"完整的，全部的，整个的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: entire, whole, complete, full, total, gross, all
means: entire ： 除了有whole的意思外，还强调既不能加一个也不减少一个的含义。
whole比entire更普通，强调每个组成部分都包括在内，无一漏掉或舍去。
complete ： 强调事物在内容、程度、或数量方面已完整，已达标准。
full ： 侧重指内容，含有能包括所有的充足内容的意味。
total与complete用法相近，但强调总量。
gross ： 侧重指未打折扣，未除去成本或皮重等与净重、净数相对。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"总数，全体"之意。
means: total ： 指总量之大，强调每一构成部分或成分均被计算在内。
sum ： 指两个或更多的数目相加的总和。
whole ： 着重其中没有部分或成分被忽略不计。

sentence.Network_en: She probably sensed that I wasn'ttelling her the whole story.
sentence.Network_cn: 她可能意识到了我并没有对她全盘托出。

sentence.Network_en: "Take That" are the best group in the whole world. So there.

sentence.Network_en: A violent explosion seemed to jolt the whole ground.
sentence.Network_cn: 剧烈的爆炸好像要把整个地面都掀起来。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly N. Amer.)everything possible or available
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主北美)任何可能的事；任何可得到的东西

lj.lj_ly: send in the troops, aircraft, nuclear submarine experts, the whole nine yards.

jx.jx_en_mean: All parts or aspects considered; altogether
jx.jx_cn_mean: 所有部分和方面都考虑到；整个看来

lj.lj_ls: 不喜欢表演但整体上喜欢这个剧

lj.lj_ls: 总的看来，是个幸福的结合

jx.jx_en_mean: In most instances or cases; as a rule
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在大多数情况下；大体上，基本上

lj.lj_ly: can expect sunny weather, on the whole.
lj.lj_ls: 大体上会有睛朗的天气

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hāl, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch heel and German heil, also to hail. The spelling with wh- (reflecting a dialect pronunciation with w-) first appeared in the 15th cent

entry.def: If you refer to the whole of something, you mean all of it.

example.ex: He has said he will make an apology to the whole of Asia for his country's past behaviour...
example.tran: 他已表示要为自己国家过去的行径向全亚洲道歉。

example.ex: I was cold throughout the whole of my body.

entry.def: A whole is a single thing which contains several different parts.

example.ex: An atom itself is a complete whole, with its electrons, protons and neutrons and other elements...
example.tran: 一个原子本身就是一个完整的整体，包括电子、质子、中子及其他元素。

example.ex: Taken as a percentage of the whole, the mouth has to be a fairly minor body part.
example.tran: 和全身比起来，嘴可算是身体中较小的一部分。

entry.def: If something is whole, it is in one piece and is not broken or damaged.

example.ex: Much of the temple was ruined, but the front was whole, as well as a large hall behind it...
example.tran: 庙宇的大部分都被毁坏了，但其正面及后面的大厅还保存完好。

example.ex: I struck the glass with my fist with all my might; yet it remained whole...
example.tran: 我用拳头拼命砸向玻璃，可它还是完好无损。

entry.def: You use whole to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: It was like seeing a whole different side of somebody...
example.tran: 这就像是看到一个人完全不同的一面。

example.ex: His father had helped invent a whole new way of doing business.
example.tran: 他父亲帮助创造了一套全新的生意经。

entry.def: If you refer to something as a whole, you are referring to it generally and as a single unit.

example.ex: He described the move as a victory for the people of South Africa as a whole...
example.tran: 他把这一举动描述成整个南非人民的胜利。

example.ex: As a whole we do not eat enough fibre in Britain.
example.tran: 总体上我们英国人没有摄入足够的膳食纤维。

entry.def: You use on the whole to indicate that what you are saying is true in general but may not be true in every case, or that you are giving a general opinion or summary of something.

example.ex: On the whole, people miss the opportunity to enjoy leisure...
example.tran: 总的来说，人们渴望享受闲暇的时光。

example.ex: The wine towns encountered are, on the whole, quiet and modest.
example.tran: 所到的酒镇总的来说都是宁静祥和的。

means.word_mean: 1. all of something including all its component elements or parts;
2. an assemblage of parts that is regarded as a single entity;

sentences.sentence: "how big is that part compared to the whole?"

means.word_mean: 1. including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete;

sentences.sentence: "the baby cried the whole trip home"

means.word_mean: 3. exhibiting or restored to vigorous good health;
1. to a complete degree or to the full or entire extent (`whole' is often used informally for `wholly');

sentences.sentence: "it was completely different from what we expected"

auth_sentence.res_content: The whole migratory cycle of eels is a mystery.

Furthermore, students will be able to purchase sections of the text instead of buying the whole thing, with individual chapters costing as little as $

Trees need more water as temperatures rise, but the prolonged droughts have robbed them of moisture, making whole forests easily cleared of trees and turned into farmland.
Runaway fires pour even more carbon into the air, which increases temperatures, starting the whole vicious cycle all over again

means.word_mean: 齐全的, 整体的, 全部的, 完全的, 所有的

sentences.en: The whole village was attacked with influenza.
sentences.cn: 整个村子的人都得了流行性感冒。

sentences.en: The old woman has been confined to her bed for a whole year.
sentences.cn: 那老妇人已经卧病在床整整一年了。

sentences.en: That's the whole truth about it.
sentences.cn: 这就是事情的全部真相。
他把整个苹果一口吃下。

means.word_mean: 没有破碎的; 完整的; 完好无损的

sentences.en: You're lucky to escape with a whole skin.
sentences.cn: 你未受损伤而逃脱, 真是幸运。

sentences.en: Did you break the whole dish?
He was surprised to find himself whole after the accident.
sentences.cn: 他惊奇地发现自己在事故发生后安然无恙。

means.word_mean: 齐全, 整体, 全部

sentences.en: The whole of my money was stolen.
sentences.cn: 我全部的钱都被偷走了。

sentences.en: He spent the whole of the week in hospital.
sentences.cn: 他住院住了整整一星期。
两个一半构成一个整体。

jushi.english: The different parts were joined to form a whole.
jushi.chinese: 不同的部分连在一起形成一个整体。

jushi.english: The whole of my money was stolen.
jushi.chinese: 我全部的钱都被偷走了。

jushi.english: The whole of the morning was wasted.
